Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2009 03:53AM Mamamari wrote: Thank you ladies, I needed that...just packing my bags now...and getting some rocky style power music to get me through the ride to the hospital! Emily I also love what your pastor said...unfortunately it was during the daylight hours I began to have doubts...nothing like standing in front of a mirror to throw your mind for a loop!  But I think I am much calmer, clearer and ready. Barb if I can help it I´m not going to be lifting so much as a magazine or remote control! Cinnabear, thx for the encouragement....I´m actually still healing from my excisional biopsy with a 3 inch scar and I must admit I was pretty impressed with my BS´s work so I have complete trust inher...she´s pretty aware i´ve asked for clean and flat...she may even clean up a fat flap under my armpit that has been bothering me for years...seems pretty trivial now but at least I wont have a natural dog ear in my armpit and no boob! My daughter wants to draw a happy face on it before we have to say goodbye to it (she´s 3) so off we go. Thank you all, and we´ll catch up with you soon. Huge Hugs to all! M.
Posts.Title: Unilateral Mx tomorrow, help! Mamamari LorenaB

Posts.Content: Mamamari wrote: Hi Ladies, Sorry I posted this in The just diagnosed although it probably belongs here so I´m reposting. Greetings sisters, Was diagnosed (finally!) 6/23 with IDC and DCIS both in different quadrants after large excisional biopsy.  Margins were not clean so we are going with unilateral Mastectomy of the right breast.  Sentinel nodes will be biopsied in surgery to determine if we can save the remaining nodes. I have opted for NO reconstruction...ever..asking my BS to make it as flat and clean as possible.  Having some major anxiety attacks now...I thought I was sure about this decision, I´ve been pretty strong and focused so far. But I just can´t help but think what if I hate it! I´m sure I would hate either decision as how can we not..but I really think I will feel better being done with any future surgeries and not having anything foreign in my body. I need some encouragement, and some words of hope that someday I will learn to live with this decision and this new form. Wishing none of us were here, but grateful you are. Mari I'm pretty sure I didn't send you an invitation! ... Mets to Bone, Brain, lung, ovaries, ya'll can get outta my house please! Dx 6/23/2009, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 1/19 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/25/2009 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right Surgery 7/6/2009 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary Chemotherapy 9/2/2009 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 12/31/2009 Dx 3/2013, IDC, Stage IV, mets Radiation Therapy 3/2/2013 Bone Radiation Therapy 4/21/2013 Brain Surgery 4/23/2013 Prophylactic ovary removal Hormonal Therapy 5/6/2013 Femara (letrozole) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Unilateral Mx tomorrow, help! Mamamari LorenaB

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2009 01:09PM Mamamari wrote: Glad the biopsy was pain free for you, even entertaining by the sounds of it!  Let us know and remember we´re here if you need us.  I had to wait a week and was a basket case at the best of times...up and down like a yoyo! So if you find yourself needing to vent or having an anxiety attack....we´re Here!!! Mari
Posts.Title: Biopsy this afternoon... micmash lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2009 03:53PM Mamamari wrote: Good luck with your Biopsy Micmash.  I do hope the results will return B9. I cannot give you any advice, just join you as I will be having an excisional biopsy for a 6cm+ mass myself on friday the 12th. so am still waiting, worrying and not impressed with my new summer plans! My biopsy was tolerable, I had a stereotactic core biopsy with 6 samples taken.  The breast was numbed very well but I will say that after the first sample the area did start to burn a bit...something like the feeling when you´ve nicked your leg shaving really good!!! It was tolerable though. And less of an ordeal than I first thought.   Will keep you in my thoughts.
Posts.Title: Biopsy this afternoon... micmash lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2009 02:14PM Mamamari wrote: Hi CC, So glad they were able to aspirate the cysts for you!  Unfortunately my original cyst masses were somewhat the same, as in so many they didn´t know where to start so they didn´t...leaving me where I am now. I had my lumpectomy on Friday and returned home Sat.  All went very well and I must say I´m pretty impressed with my surgeons work considering the size. Final pathology is in tomorrow so I´ll be sure to post as soon as I know. Hopefully we´ll both have good news to share! Mx
Posts.Title: What questions should I be asking? CCinwashington Mamamari

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2009 10:16AM Mamamari wrote: Hi CC, Good luck tomorrow! I was pleasantly surprised that my Biposy wasn´t as bad as I had imagined and I was alone (the only breakdown moment for me came when I was in the OR prep area waiting to go in and all these foreign speaking doctors kept checking on my chart and all I could think was Ïs this for real!) Otherwise I managed just fine on my own and drove home immediately after. I also have a young child and we´re on our own most of the time (husband works away) so for me the hardest has been organizing my various appts. And keeping everything in one file has definitely been helpful...that way if I had forgotten a question in one visit I always had everything with me to reference it again. I also had been diagnosed with cysts...almost 3 yrs ago, last year they doubled in size...this year they´re triple (over golf ball size) with 3 different micro calc clusters within...my biopsy came back inconclusive and I just wasn´t satisfied they had managed to get the spot (long saga) so tomorrow it´s off to have it fully removed and then biopsied.  And even though I may be slightly anxious about the surgery, it is nothing in comparison to having this ´Thing´ out of my body and getting a 100% confirmation. You´ll need to assess how you feel once your results are in. Will be thinking of you...and feel free to send a private message if you´re in need! Uno Fuerta Abrazo! Mari
Posts.Title: What questions should I be asking? CCinwashington Mamamari

Posts.Content: Mamamari wrote: Hi everyone, I´m a 36yr old mother of a 3yr old who is living on an Island in Spain.  My husband works on the mainland and so is only able to come home for weekends and will soon be away for 3 months solid. I ´ve had a large mass slowly growing for over 3 yrs, last year (in Canada) it was diagnosed as just cystic and nothing to worry about.  several weeks ago however I noticed bleeding and clear fluid leaking from one of my ducts (I´m still breast feeding) so back to a new Gyno, who immediately sent me for a new Mammo and ultrasound with a specialist, he immediately recommended biopsy.  My Dr. wasn´t too confident in the system here on the Island and wanted to send me to either London, Barcelona or Germany. My insurance however had other ideas and said no..it would have to be done locally. Through a week of banging my head against the wall and trying to figure out insurance and who to even call I finally found a breast pathologist who agreed to see me immediately. Well he took one look at my chart and scheduled me in for the core biopsy the next day.  I haven´t even had time to look for information on what this all is. He took approx. 7 samples (leaving me stinging and bruised) but otherwise it wasn´t too bad. I think the worst was having it done in the OR so waiting on the gurney outside without a hand to hold and then being wheeled into the OR room and looking up at those massive lights and thinking just how real this is. He´s said he´ll have the results in 1 week and in the mean time sent me for chest X-rays and an ultrasound of my liver and kidneys as well as some additional blood work and a trip to another hospital to book an MRI (Nothing is done for you or sent to your Dr here, you must pick up all your results, get your insurance authorizations, and book all appts even though you don´t have a clue what your booking..It´s doing my head in!)  I feel like I haven´t had a chance to even breath and I´m freaked but trying to be optimistic. I´m fortunate to have very good friends rallying around to support me and help with childcare etc. But it is hard to think that I may get bad news and not have my husband there with me if I do. To top it off I think (though I may be getting lost in translation) that my Doc is telling me that even if it is B9 we may still have to treat it with Chemo to shrink it and remove the breast  Understandably it is the size of a small lemon Not exactly small. Just waiting and hoping and trying not to freak out and let the docs run over me and not even sure where to start in making decisions for myself. I think I´ve also read that you cannot do an MRI on a lactating breast??? Sorry for the rambles just needed to get it out there!  I'm pretty sure I didn't send you an invitation! ... Mets to Bone, Brain, lung, ovaries, ya'll can get outta my house please! Dx 6/23/2009, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 1/19 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/25/2009 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right Surgery 7/6/2009 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary Chemotherapy 9/2/2009 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 12/31/2009 Dx 3/2013, IDC, Stage IV, mets Radiation Therapy 3/2/2013 Bone Radiation Therapy 4/21/2013 Brain Surgery 4/23/2013 Prophylactic ovary removal Hormonal Therapy 5/6/2013 Femara (letrozole) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy in Spain...waiting and worrying Mamamari Mamamari

Posts.Content: May 14, 2009 03:03PM Mamamari wrote: Thank you for your replies, It is so helpful to be able to vent and get some straight understandable info! idaho: I´m not sure I´ve even been understanding them correctly.  Last year when I was told I had cysts they informed me that I would have to have them removed as there were too many to effectively drain...over hundreds massed together.  Now I´m told the cysts are just part of the mass and that there is a tumor surrounding it all...it´s doubled in size from last year and what was a thumbnail sized cyst 3 yrs ago, became a 5cm or so mass last year...and is now nearly the entire lower breast.  All I keep hearing is shrink tumor remove breast, shrink tumor remove...shrink tumor....I believe from what they are looking at they are thinking it is IDC. I will definitely post the results here before I make any decisions.  I´m just not sure what is being lost in translation and what is just doctor speak far above my head and what is just my own head making up stuff because I can´t quite remember what is being said to me. I´m almost certain my Dr. told me that in his opinion what he was looking at is usually malignant and we would begin treatment as soon as possible....Like WHAT?! He hadn´t even done the biopsy yet and surely he wouldn´t just let that spill out without some kind of sensitivity and preparation?!?!? Just thoroughly confused.
Posts.Title: Biopsy in Spain...waiting and worrying Mamamari Mamamari

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2009 04:33PM Mamamari wrote: lighting a candle to mark your one year with you! Glad that you are okay and wanted to thank you for having been brave enough to post last year...and just now..as I was able to read your story and find some strength in it. for 3 yrs I was told I had nothing but cysts as they grew and grew..and now....New doctors, new symptoms and headed for a lumpectomy. Your story has encouraged me and reenforced that I am doing the right thing and pushing for an answer.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: hi, new here -> shocking story! ?? lightacandle lightacandle

Posts.Content: May 27, 2009 05:29AM Mamamari wrote: Hi Marietjie, I´m sorry I can´t really answer your question but wanted to send you a hug back.  I´m currently still in limbo waiting myself... From what I can make out...my Dr. isn´t really telling me anything, but of the 7 samples they removed via core biopsy they have come back negative but suspicious (whatever that means) I´m in the process of changing Dr´s!!! He is still certain there is a malignancy there somewhere...It´s a REALLY big mass. Has this just happened to you or are you trying to decide if you should have them removed??? Sure someone will chime in with proper advice soon...until then Hugs back! Mari
Posts.Title: Biopsy results mpieterse desdemona222b

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2009 06:23AM Mamamari wrote: Good Luck today, I was diagnosed this year at 36, but the docs should have caught it 3 yrs ago! Sound like you may have a more proactive Doc.  Looking forward to hearing good news for you.
Posts.Title: nervous young mom suthrnatheart Lauren3

Posts.Content: Mamamari wrote: Hi ladies, I´ve been posting about my saga over in the waiting for tests forum so to make a long story short... After, Mammo´s, US, Stereotactic Core Biopsy (6 samples taken) based on 2007 Mammos not current ones, blood tests, and finally an MRI, my doctors are still unsure. The only thing they know for sure is that I have fibroadenomas with aggressive Hyperplasia, and that invasive neoplasia is unknown. They still can not tell if it is Usual or Atypical I was told that the samples were not enough to test beyond this and have been scheduled for an excisional biopsy this friday June 12th.   I´m very nervous about this as the mass is over 6cm with additional suspicious areas that are about 1 - 2cm as well, and she wants wide margins. I feel I´ll be losing nearly half my breast just to make sure! I´m exhausted from all this testing and waiting and worrying and just want this to be explained already! marking another day in the waiting game. Mari  I'm pretty sure I didn't send you an invitation! ... Mets to Bone, Brain, lung, ovaries, ya'll can get outta my house please! Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy scheduled, 6cm mass Mamamari Mamamari

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2009 05:47PM Mamamari wrote: Thank you for your encouragement Marin, I agree that there´s nothing normal about it! I think I´m just angry at the moment, I first found the lump 3 yrs ago in my final months of pregnancy. Dr´s diagnosed cyst, 2 yrs later...4 times the size and docs still said nothing to worry about, I was still breastfeeding so they just brushed it off and said to get it checked when I finished feeding no big deal. 3 yrs later it´s the size of half my breast and yes I´m still feeding...now I read up that hyperplasia usually grows due to a trigger and can subside once the trigger is removed.  So I´m sitting here thinking that perhaps the extended breastfeeding was actually the trigger and if I had been told any of this a year ago I would have stopped and not let it get this far. As now all of the tests are showing highly suspicious characteristics which were not there a year ago.   I´m definitely going to the mat with this as I feel my 1st Doc really just went in stabbing blind and probably biopsied the mass of cysts that we knew were there...and not what was new and lighting up the screens! So I would prefer the 100% result route! Does anyone out there have any experience with a lumpectomy / excisional biopsy of this size, I know nothing about quadrants but am pretty sure it fills 3/4 of my lower breast with additional lumps closer to the chest wall on both sides of it. I´m wondering what I should expect.
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy scheduled, 6cm mass Mamamari Mamamari

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2009 05:53PM Mamamari wrote: Well now what..... as I´ve had hot flashes, breast fed for 3 yrs, do have hay fever AND went to disneyland when I was 10! should I be expecting a flood and start wearing maxipads in my bra??? Seriously though, this waiting Is getting tiresome and unexplained answers are really annoying, sorry you are having to deal with that Eagle. Nikkiea, thank you for the encouragement, I hope you´ve had satisfactory explanations! LynnB....thx for the laugh even though I know it came from a source of frustration.  Hoping your name will be called soon and you can get outta the fricken waiting room! Me...I probably spoke too soon as I probably Will have maxipads in my bra after my lumpectomy/ exsicional biopsy...frozen ones...oh goody!

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 07:09PM Mamamari wrote: Hi All, Eagle, sorry...kinda left a cliff hanger on that one....the pathologist didn´t have my results finished. Apparently they decided to run a different test that took longer and didn´t think to inform my doctor. Mañana Mañana..when in Spain! Picking them up tomorrow on way to Doctors appt...hopefully stitches out too!  Oh what a day to look forward too! ...hmmm I think I´d rather be covering chairs!?!
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 10:38AM - edited Jun 23, 2009 10:39AM by Mamamari Yup definitly would have rather been covering chairs! I´m afraid the B9 chain is broken yet again. My largest mass of "cysts" returned with DCIS, and the smaller newest lump came back as IDC at 2cm. Scheduling mastectomy next week and they´ll check the sentinal node then. Bugga!!! Just absorbing the news now so will get back to the boards after a wee Gin and tonic and nap with my daughter.
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2009 04:09PM Mamamari wrote: Congrats Amy and Eagle But sorry Lynne...is there room for one more in that group?! I´ve was diagnosed with cysts over 3 yrs ago and then 2 yrs ago they had grown to a mass of so many cysts they didn´t care to count, all doctors told me not to worry about them, they were not cancerous and eventually could be removed once I finished breastfeeding.  2 months ago I noticed clear plasma discharge that turned bloody within days and then rust coloured. It´s back to clear with streaks of rust but it was enough for me to get in and ask them what the heck was going on now?! U/S, mammo, MRI are all lit up like the 4th of July and there are microcalcifications Everywhere. the only thing that is giving me hope is that the Biopsy returned with nothing but Hyperplasia (type unknown) unfortunately my new BS thinks that the biopsy wouldn´t have picked anything up if it didn´t hit the right spots (biopsy doc stabbed in blind) so now it´s on to an excisional biopsy/ Lumpectomy. I wasn´t satisfied with the results and neither was my BS...so we´re pushing forward.  I wish you and Nicolle the best of luck and am doing a B9 chant for you.
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2009 05:05PM Mamamari wrote: Hi ladies, Just wanted to update...haven´t been up to getting on the computer the last week. Had my Lumpectomy on Friday and according to my surgeon all went well, I just had 1 night in the hospital and then opted to go home and let the fhubby pamper me.  No need for Maxi pads but the madonna inspired bullet bra bandaging sure was stellar!  Took those off Monday and must admit she seems to have done a fine job considering the amount she took out.   Going to pick up my final pathology report tomorrow and a visit to the doc to check on the healing...still not quite ready to look at that but at least my unease at that is keeping me from worrying about the results. Grabbing as many B9 vibes as I can!
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2009 12:18PM Mamamari wrote: Eagle, So happy to hear your good news!!! Wow wish my docs had been that proactive!!! Sorry I have been off this thread and out of it for some months as I went through my surgeries (1 for the excisional Lumpectomy, 1 for the right Mastectomy, and the 3rd to remove the lymph nodes) then it was recovery time and onto the Chemo train.  Just going through it all now and trying to keep my head looking forward. SO glad you were able to catch it so early and I am certainly a firm believer that if it ain't working get it out and find out why!!! Zymurgist, glad to here you qualify for the program, good luck.
